Key Match Events: Tim David and Mitchell Marsh helped Australia secure a dramatic last-ball win against New Zealand, chasing down 16 in the final over in Wellington.
Fifties from opener Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra set the tone for New Zealand after they opted to bat first against Australia.
Tim David scored 31 runs from 10 deliveries with two fours and three sixes.
Josh Inglis was dismissed by Mitchell Santner for 20 runs.
David Warner scored 32 runs before being dismissed by Mitchell Santner.
Finn Allen scored 32 runs before being dismissed by Mitchell Starc.
Devon Conway scored 63 runs before being dismissed by Mitchell Marsh.
Rachin Ravindra scored 68 runs before being dismissed by Pat Cummins.
Pre-Game Insights: The 2021 T20 world champion Australia will have an arsenal of destructive forces at their disposal with the likes of Glenn Maxwell and Tim David being available.
David Warner is on what should be his last tour to New Zealand as the opener has retired from all other formats to prepare for the T20 World Cup.
New Zealand will be without their regular skipper Kane Williamson who has been rested after his exploits against South Africa, with Mitchell Santner standing in as the skipper.
Skipper Mitch Marsh has suggested that Steve Smith might not make the Playing XI.
David Warner needs 54 runs to become the all-time leading run scorer for Australia in men’s T20Is.
Glenn Maxwell will surpass Aaron Finch for the most appearances for Australia in men’s T20Is.
Lockie Ferguson needs one wicket to become the second-fastest Kiwi bowler to reach 50 T20I wickets.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Sky Stadium, Wellington.
Australia beat New Zealand by 6 wickets.
The T20I series will be followed by two Tests.
